title: Telstra chairman John Mullen adds Brambles to busy load
text:
John Mullen, who is already the chairman of Telstra, will add the chairmanship of logistics group Brambles to his workload from next year.

Mr Mullen will become a director of Brambles from November 1 and has been named chairman-elect, to assume the top job in the boardroom when long-serving Brambles chairman Stephen Johns retires in 2020.

Mr Mullen has been chairman of Telstra since 2016 and is also the chairman of the logistics company Toll Group, now owned by Japan Post. Toll Group has been making losses in a fiercely competitive sector in Australia.

Japan Post bought Toll for $6.5 billion in 2015 but the Australian group subsequently incurred losses and the Japanese company was forced to take a $4.9 billion write-down in 2017.

Telstra chairman John Mullen has been anointed as chairman-elect of Brambles. Nick Moir

Mr Mullen is also a director of Brookfield Infrastructure Partners LP.
description: Former Asciano CEO John Mullen has been named chairman-elect of Brambles and will have a big workload as he is already Telstra chairman
